data.value: The matrix a is stored in
either in lower diagonal or upper diagonal ordered form:
ab[u + i - j, j] == a[i,j]        (if upper form; i <= j)     ab[    i - j, j] == a[i,j]        (if lower form; i >= j)

upper form:
*   *   a02 a13 a24 a35
*   a01 a12 a23 a34 a45
a00 a11 a22 a33 a44 a55

lower form:
a00 a11 a22 a33 a44 a55
a10 a21 a32 a43 a54 *
a20 a31 a42 a53 *   *
Cells marked with * are not used.
Is the matrix in the lower form. (Default is upper form)

Whether to check that the input matrices contain only finite numbers. Disabling may give a performance gain, but may result in problems (crashes, non-termination) if the inputs do contain infinities or NaNs.
The solution to the system a x = b. Shape of return matches shape of
Solve equation a x = b. a is Hermitian positive-definite banded matrix.
contains the main diagonal and the nonzero diagonals below the main diagonal. That is, we use the lower form:
In this example, we put the upper diagonals in the array

signature.value: solveh_banded(ab, b, overwrite_ab=False, overwrite_b=False, lower=False, check_finite=True)
